bibl.title: Letter from Elihu Root to Charles William Eliot, May 31, 1902

div1.p: Root acknowledges receipt of recommendations from the Faculty of Medicine at Harvard University for the nomination of Reed to the position of Surgeon General. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Elihu Root to Charles William Eliot, May 31, 1902
div1.p:
I am in receipt, by reference from the President, of the letter
of May 16th, signed by yourself and other members of the Faculty of
Medicine of Harvard University, in behalf of the appointment of Major
Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army, as Surgeon-General of the Army upon the
retirement of the present incumbent. The matter will receive the full
consideration to which the eminent services of yourself, as well as the
others members of the Faculty of Medicine of Harvard University, to
science entitle it. Of course capacity for administration and qualities
quite apart from scientific attainments will have an important bearing upon
the decision.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Elihu Root Secretary of War.
Charles W. Eliot, Esq.,
President of Harvard University,
Cambridge, Mass.
